.@POTUS @TheJusticeDept the @FBI and @USAO_EDWA William Hyslop are sending a strong signal today that America won’t let the CCP go unchecked for its ruthless criminal enterprise of stealing our trade secrets and tech to get ahead. My full statement ⤵️. https://t.co/3FQB5FzlD2

Propaganda & misinformation on social media from authoritarian regimes (like the CCP) needs to be combatted. Free speech needs to be protected in the process. @RepGuthrie’s bill will look for ways to use emerging tech like AI to fight Chinese propaganda & promote American values.
At the same time we need to protect our data from the Chinese Communist Party. @RepJeffDuncan’s TELL Act will bring transparency to companies who store Americans’ data in China.

The internet knows no borders. The free flow of data between America & our allies increases all countries’  prosperity. It also helps drive data innovation. @RepFredUpton’s bill will prove why data protectionism is harmful and promote more agreements like EU-US Privacy Shield.

.@RepBillJohnson is leading to help startups succeed across the country not just in coastal cities like New York and San Francisco. We need to unleash innovation in all parts of America—from Spokane WA to Marietta OH— if we want to beat China and win the future.

The gig economy gives people more flexibility and options in the workforce. Rep. Gianforte’s Advancing the Gig Economy Act will lead to policies to grow jobs & boost the gig economy— not kill it like CA’s AB5.

Apps make businesses more efficient & improve peoples’ lives. We need to be cautious about where they are developed. Foreign apps— like from China— can invade our privacy & threaten data security. @RepKinzinger is leading to boost app transparency before people download them.
.@boblatta is also leading on the SMART IOT Act which will encourage further American leadership and security in connected devices that have the potential to transform our economy.

Autonomous deliveries have been critical during this pandemic for the most vulnerable to receive needed supplies like food and their medications. @boblatta is leading so America is the global leader in AV deliveries.

.@RepMGriffith is leading to maintain our lead in the quantum computing race. Quantum computing is making innovation possible in everything from new pharmaceuticals to encryption to national security. To lead the world in new discoveries we cannot let China surpass us.
IoT manufacturing can be the future of new and more jobs in America. @RepRichHudson’s Advancing IoT Manufacturing Act will help speed the deployment of connected manufacturing.

Right now China controls much of the world’s supply of new and advanced materials which we need to manufacture everything from smartphones to next-gen energy tech. @RepLarryBucshon’s bill will make the US more self-sufficient to access and use these materials.

3D printing and additive manufacturing will help America  reduce our reliance on Chinese supply chains. Both support American jobs & our national security.That’s why @michaelcburgess is leading on the Advancing 3D Printing Act.
.@RepGuthrie is leading on a bill to spur blockchain. Blockchain is crucial to securing data and protecting privacy.

China is also using facial recognition technology to oppress its people and Uighur minorities. @RepBuddyCarter’s bill will identify the potential harms of facial recognition tech to ensure it’s developed safely right here in America.
It’s America that is best equipped to lead on AI and develop it with our values for freedom human rights and human dignity. The GAINS Act is a key step to achieving that.

My GAINS Act will help us beat the Chinese in the global AI race. The Chinese Communist Party uses AI to control surveil and oppress. American innovators are using it to save lives discover cures and diagnose cancers more quickly.
These are 14 emerging tech bills from members of the Consumer Protection & Commerce Subcommittee. ⤵️
To win the future we should be focusing on emerging technologies that enhance consumer protection AND boost America’s competitive edge to beat China. https://t.co/MM4BO8MDSD

✅ That’s how America wins the future and maintains our global competitive edge so our economy booms again.

As we kickstart the breakthroughs necessary to end the pandemic America should lead and get a national standard for data privacy right.   *Bottomline: Now is the time to build trust to keep innovation going in emerging life-saving tech like AI blockchain & quantum computing.
❌We can’t trust China. The Chinese Communist Party is using this crisis to expand unlimited government surveillance and control of its own citizens. https://t.co/mTVC2byyc1

Here’s a new report from the US on how Europe’s privacy law is endangering public safety.   “Since the implementation of GDPR important joint health research between U.S. and EU based universities and research institutions has been impeded…”  https://t.co/LukJRnm6B3

❌Not Europe. Their privacy regulatory regime is dangerously holding back health research in this crisis. It also prevented grocers from making timely food deliveries to 1.5 million vulnerable people in self-isolation. https://t.co/blGrpOrF6d

What we know: As we search for new tools that will save lives get people back to work and reopen the economy the coronavirus response is ushering in a new era of data surveillance.  Who would you rather lead this new era? 🌎

I’ve made the case before why trust is impossible to build in a patchwork of state laws. Read that in my @MorningConsult op-ed.   🚨NEWS: The coronavirus pandemic is making clear a national standard is more urgent than ever. Next tweet…  https://t.co/QXgbaXkIga

How do we build trust? ⤵️  The best way to build trust is with a workable national standard for data privacy that is pro-consumer & pro-innovation. It should set clear rules for transparency on how our data is used stored and shared.

Widespread adoption requires building & keeping people’s trust. We need to trust our data is protected from misuse by the government and businesses.   ❌Without trust there won’t be widespread adoption.

I’m urging my colleagues to stand up for families like mine. Together—as warriors for human dignity and human value—let’s lead America to a future where we cherish the life liberty and pursuit of happiness for ALL.

Again the Left is promoting a bill tomorrow that lifts limits on abortions at nearly any stage of pregnancy and for any reason including for babies with Down syndrome. It’s sad.  Is this the future we want for America? Who will stand up and say enough?

As our friend Frank Stephens would say Cole’s life is worth living. Today he’s almost 13 years old. He's smart & loves sports. He’s a great big brother to our daughters Grace & Brynn. All five of us just skied down Mt. Spokane this weekend. It was a joy for the entire family.

But Cole’s life couldn’t be further from what we were told. He’s opened our eyes to the dignity and potential of every life. He’s reminded me that just because challenges in life are hard it doesn’t mean they aren’t valuable.

Doctors gave us a long list of challenges and complications. We were told don’t expect much. In that moment I could see how the fear of the unknown could make us question everything.   Could we give Cole everything that life had to offer? Could we handle this?
I think back to the uncertainty the fear. Even when I was pregnant it was scary especially the first time! My oldest Cole was born with Down syndrome. It wasn’t what Brian or I hoped for or dreamed.

That changed in my first term when I met Brian. We got married and became pregnant shortly after. Three kids later I can testify today that becoming a mom has been the best thing to have happened in my life. The absolute best thing.

Every woman’s journey to motherhood is different. Something that unites us though is the uncertainty and fear of the unknown.  For me I was 35 and single when I was elected to Congress. I wasn’t sure about having kids. Was I a baby person? Would it ever happen for me?

Tomorrow Democrats on @EnergyCommerce are taking action to promote unlimited abortions at nearly any stage of pregnancy and for any reason.  Their pro-abortion agenda is extreme. It’s scary.  Will any say this goes too far?

If you know me you know my #prolife story. Maybe you read it in 2018 when I responded to an opinion in the @washingtonpost that said lives of people with #Downsyndrome weren’t worth living.   I’m telling my story AGAIN bc the value & dignity of all life is STILL under attack...
